      RequirementRoot ListReader.getParent(RequirementRoot input)
      Determine the correct parent of the current requirement to build a tree structure; must be called after each call to ListReader.processParagraph(Paragraph) and ListReader.injectListItem(Integer, int, String) Note: If there are placeholder requirements (i.e. skipped levels) this will return the parent of the very first placeholder.
      RequirementRoot ListToRequirementProcessor.getRootRequirement() 
      Methods in docreader.list with parameters of type RequirementRoot 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Add a new nesting level
      RequirementRoot ListReader.getParent(RequirementRoot input)
      Determine the correct parent of the current requirement to build a tree structure; must be called after each call to ListReader.processParagraph(Paragraph) and ListReader.injectListItem(Integer, int, String) Note: If there are placeholder requirements (i.e. skipped levels) this will return the parent of the very first placeholder.
      void ListToRequirementProcessor.setLastRequirement(RequirementRoot lastRequirement)
      Set the last processed requirement to an arbitrary value

    • Uses of RequirementRoot in requirement

      Subclasses of RequirementRoot in requirement 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  RequirementOrdinary
      Class for plain, ordinary requirements (i.e. something with all features of a requirement enabled)
      class  RequirementPlaceholder
      Requirement which does not actually exist in the input document but which needs to be inserted in order to maintain a proper hierarchy (used for skipped levels)
      class  RequirementTemporary
      Requirement which can hold text, but is not linked to any surrounding tree of requirements
      class  RequirementWParent
      Requirement with a mandatory parent

      This is necessary for fake rooting this requirement in tests
